headline.main: INNOCENT OF PLOT, SAYS ACCUSED SPY; He Helped Make Radio Merely to 'Gain Experience,' U.S. Jury in Brooklyn Hears GOT SUSPICIOUS AND QUIT But He Admits Repairing Set Even After His Curiosity on Nazi Link Was Aroused

lead_paragraph: The government's case against Josef August Klein, 37-year-old commercial photographer, who with fifteen others is accused of espionage and failure to register as agents of a foreign government, opened yesterday with the reading of a statement purportedly made by Klein to government agents in which he admitted that the activities of several of his co-defendants had aroused his "suspicions" that they were violating the espionage laws of the United States.
abstract: Espionage: J A Klein's statement on helping A Wheeler-Hill and F Jahnke with radio transmitter read
